U.S. Marshal Raylan Givens is reassigned from Miami to his childhood home in the poor, rural coal mining towns of eastern Kentucky." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1489428/","name":"Justified","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgzNjQ4NjM1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQ4OTEzNw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0648249/","name":"Timothy Olyphant"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0780678/","name":"Nick Searcy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0141710/","name":"Joelle Carter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0216537/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280908/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003113/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003662/","name":"Graham Yost"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Painkiller","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi963026457","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTk4MzQ5ODUxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODk3MTMxNw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTk4MzQ5ODUxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODk3MTMxNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A preview trailer for the upcoming season of "Justified.""},"datePublished":"2010-03-16","description":"U.S. Marshal Raylan Givens is reassigned from Miami to his childhood home in the poor, rural coal mining towns of eastern Kentucky.","keywords":"reference to the gunfight at the o.k. corral,reference to the o.k. corral,gang,cowboy,gunslinger","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1489428/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"f_nastase"},"dateCreated":"2015-05-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Definitely worth every second I've spent in front of the screen","reviewBody":"Positively one of the best TV shows I've seen in years. I, for one, didn't cared as much about gun action( which by they way is abundant) as I did for the excellent dialogue and the acting. Acting in particular is extremely good, not one single character is out of his role, to be truthful even a dog if you see in a scene in this series, you get the feeling that it's exactly where that dog belongs to. As for the dialogue, it is so good, that it's actually the only flaw this show has. It seems very unlikely that all that crowd of cunning rednecks have such a large arsenal of polite irony, well placed quotes, to the border of well educated people and yet fall over and over to next man's scheme or simply go down by the hand of their own stupidity. Anyways I cannot up-vote this show enough and I can only suggest to make yourselves comfortable in any greasy sofa you have, and prepare to get ported to Harlan, Kentucky.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":89022,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.6}}</script><metacontent="

I, for one, didn't cared as much about gun action( which by they way is abundant) as I did for the excellent dialogue and the acting. Acting in particular is extremely good, not one single character is out of his role, to be truthful even a dog if you see in a scene in this series, you get the feeling that it's exactly where that dog belongs to. As for the dialogue, it is so good, that it's actually the only flaw this show has. It seems very unlikely that all that crowd of cunning rednecks have such a large arsenal of polite irony, well placed quotes, to the border of well educated people and yet fall over and over to next man's scheme or simply go down by the hand of their own stupidity. Anyways I cannot up-vote this show enough and I can only suggest to make yourselves comfortable in any greasy sofa you have, and prepare to get ported to Harlan, Kentucky.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":89022,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.6</script><metacontent="
